page.title: 15Trendle Ring
page.content: There are many interesting {Prehistoric Sites}on the Quantock Hills and there is one particularly interesting one just behind the village of Bicknoller. It is called {Trendle Ring}and as its name would suggest it is a circular enclosure. It covers nearly a hectare and is delightfully situated on a spur of {Bicknoller Hill. }It is almost impossible to see from above and although more easily detected from the Village below its excellent defensive position can be appreciated. The entrance to this earthwork is to be found in the North Eastern corner and suprisingly a modern footpath still runs through this entrance. In Prehistoric times it would have been used for people to live in and to keep their livestock near them.
